AdditionalFields.Value: Clinical Research Excluding Trials,Experimental and Molecular Therapeutics,Survivorship

Description: This session will cover cutting edge discoveries in host-tumor interactions that will include the role of aging, immunity, gender, obesity, microbiome, and tumor microenvironment in melanoma progression and the effects on targeted and immunotherapies.Â  Topics that will be covered will include the manipulation of tumor-infiltrating lymphocytes (TIL) with CRISPR technology to alter T Cell metabolism for improved therapeutic efficacy, the role of diet, obesity, and gender on the efficacy of immunotherapy, and the influence of aging and gender on fibroblasts and other cells in the tumor microenvironment.
SearchResultBody: AOS11. The Role of Aging, Immunity, Microbiome, and Metabolism in Next Generation Melanoma Therapeutics
Title: The Role of Aging, Immunity, Microbiome, and Metabolism in Next Generation Melanoma Therapeutics
